swathe.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a long thin area of something, especially land
swathe.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The bomb had left a swathe of the town centre in ruins.
A swathe of sunlight lay across the floor.
swathe.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a long thin area of grass or plants that has been cut down
swathe.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: We cut a swathe through the dense undergrowth.
swathe.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to wrap or cover something in something
swathe.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The moon was swathed in mist.
